intro: Ceraria kuneneana, commonly known as the Kunene ceraria, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and arid landscapes.
